title: Rotor Angle Stability
description: The ability to remain in synchronism under normal and disturbed conditions.

sections.title: Definition in an Article by a Task Force
sections.body_md: > Rotor angle stability is concerned with the ability of the interconnected synchronous machines in a power system to **remain in synchronism** under normal operating conditions and to regain synchronism after being subjected to a small or large disturbance.

sections.title: Definition in a European Union Regulation
sections.body_md: > 'rotor angle stability' means the ability of synchronous machines to remain in synchronism under N-situation and after being subject to a disturbance;
